MS.S: Sample Module with Pipeline scripts and its Plaster template to create a module following some of the community accepted practices.

## [0.117.0] - 2023-09-29_x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_### Added_x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_- Integration tests to build and import a module created using the Plaster_x000D__x000A_ template _SimpleModule_._x000D__x000A_- Support [ModuleFast](https://github.com/JustinGrote/ModuleFast) when_x000D__x000A_ restoring dependencies by adding the parameter `UseModuleFast` to the_x000D__x000A_ `build.ps1`, e.g. `./build.ps1 -Tasks noop -ResolveDependency -UseModuleFast`_x000D__x000A_ or by enabling it in the configuration file Resolve-Dependency.psd1._x000D__x000A_ Using ModuleFast will resolve dependencies much faster, but requires_x000D__x000A_ PowerShell 7.2._x000D__x000A_- Support for [PSResourceGet (beta release)](https://github.com/PowerShell/PSResourceGet)._x000D__x000A_ If the modules PSResourceGet can be bootstrapped they will be used. If_x000D__x000A_ PSResourceGet cannot be bootstrapped then it will revert to using_x000D__x000A_ PowerShellGet v2.2.5. If the user requests or configures to use ModuleFast_x000D__x000A_ then that will override both PSResourceGet and PowerShellGet. The method_x000D__x000A_ PSResourceGet can be enabled in the configuration file Resolve-Dependency.psd1._x000D__x000A_ It is also possible to use PSResourceGet by adding the parameter `UsePSResourceGet`_x000D__x000A_ to the `build.ps1`, e.g. `./build.ps1 -Tasks noop -ResolveDependency -UsePSResourceGet`._x000D__x000A_- When using PSResourceGet to resolve dependencies it also possible to_x000D__x000A_ use PowerShellGet v2.9.0 (previous _CompatPowerShellGet_). To use the_x000D__x000A_ compatibility module it can be enabled in the configuration file Resolve-Dependency.psd1._x000D__x000A_ It is also possible to use it by adding the parameter `UsePowerShellGetCompatibilityModule`_x000D__x000A_ to the `build.ps1`, e.g. `./build.ps1 -Tasks noop -ResolveDependency -UsePSResourceGet -UsePowerShellGetCompatibilityModule`._x000D__x000A_ _The 2.9.0-preview has since then been unlisted, the compatibility__x000D__x000A_ _module will now be released as PowerShellGet v3.0.0.__x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_### Changed_x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_- Task `publish_nupkg_to_gallery`_x000D__x000A_ - Add support for publishing a NuGet package to a gallery using the .NET SDK in addition to using nuget.exe. Fixes [#433](https://github.com/gaelcolas/Sampler/issues/433)_x000D__x000A_- Split up unit tests and integration tests in separate pipeline jobs since_x000D__x000A_ integration tests could change state on a developers machine, and in the_x000D__x000A_ current PowerShell session. Integration tests no longer run when running_x000D__x000A_ `./build.ps1 -Tasks test`. To run integration tests pass the parameter_x000D__x000A_ `PesterPath`, e.g. `./build.ps1 -Tasks test -PesterPath 'tests/Integration'`._x000D__x000A_- Added sample private function and public function samples to Plaster template_x000D__x000A_ _SimpleModule_ so that it is possible to run task `test` without it failing._x000D__x000A_- Sample Private function tests updated to Pester 5._x000D__x000A_- Sample Public function tests updated to Pester 5._x000D__x000A_- Sampler's build.ps1 and the template build.ps1 was aligned._x000D__x000A_- PowerShell Team will release the PSResourceGet compatibility module_x000D__x000A_ (previously known as CompatPowerShellGet) as PowerShellGet v2.9.0 (or_x000D__x000A_ higher). The resolve dependency script, when PowerShellGet is used, will_x000D__x000A_ use `MaximumVersion` set to `2.8.999` to make sure the expected_x000D__x000A_ PowerShellGet version is installed, today that it is v2.2.5._x000D__x000A_ _The 2.9.0-preview has since then been unlisted, the compatibility__x000D__x000A_ _module will now be released as PowerShellGet v3.0.0.__x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_### Fixed_x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_- Fix unit tests that was wrongly written and failed on Pester 5.5._x000D__x000A_- There was different behavior on PowerShell and Windows PowerShell when_x000D__x000A_ creating the module manifest. So when the `modify` section that was meant_x000D__x000A_ to reuse the already present but commented `Prerelease` key it also ran_x000D__x000A_ the `modify` statement that adds a `Prerelease` key that is needed for_x000D__x000A_ a module manifest that is created under Windows PowerShell. This resulted_x000D__x000A_ in two `Prerelease` keys when creating a module under PowerShell 7.x._x000D__x000A_ Now it will add a commented `Perelease` key and then next `modify` statement_x000D__x000A_ will remove the comment, making it work on all version of PowerShell._x000D__x000A_ Fixes [#436](https://github.com/gaelcolas/Sampler/issues/436)._x000D__x000A_- The QA test template was updated so that it is possible to run the tests_x000D__x000A_ without the need to add a git remote (remote `origin`).
Sample Module with Pipeline scripts and its Plaster template to create a module following some of the community accepted practices.

## [0.117.0] - 2023-09-29_x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_### Added_x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_- Integration tests to build and import a module created using the Plaster_x000D__x000A_ template _SimpleModule_._x000D__x000A_- Support [ModuleFast](https://github.com/JustinGrote/ModuleFast) when_x000D__x000A_ restoring dependencies by adding the parameter `UseModuleFast` to the_x000D__x000A_ `build.ps1`, e.g. `./build.ps1 -Tasks noop -ResolveDependency -UseModuleFast`_x000D__x000A_ or by enabling it in the configuration file Resolve-Dependency.psd1._x000D__x000A_ Using ModuleFast will resolve dependencies much faster, but requires_x000D__x000A_ PowerShell 7.2._x000D__x000A_- Support for [PSResourceGet (beta release)](https://github.com/PowerShell/PSResourceGet)._x000D__x000A_ If the modules PSResourceGet can be bootstrapped they will be used. If_x000D__x000A_ PSResourceGet cannot be bootstrapped then it will revert to using_x000D__x000A_ PowerShellGet v2.2.5. If the user requests or configures to use ModuleFast_x000D__x000A_ then that will override both PSResourceGet and PowerShellGet. The method_x000D__x000A_ PSResourceGet can be enabled in the configuration file Resolve-Dependency.psd1._x000D__x000A_ It is also possible to use PSResourceGet by adding the parameter `UsePSResourceGet`_x000D__x000A_ to the `build.ps1`, e.g. `./build.ps1 -Tasks noop -ResolveDependency -UsePSResourceGet`._x000D__x000A_- When using PSResourceGet to resolve dependencies it also possible to_x000D__x000A_ use PowerShellGet v2.9.0 (previous _CompatPowerShellGet_). To use the_x000D__x000A_ compatibility module it can be enabled in the configuration file Resolve-Dependency.psd1._x000D__x000A_ It is also possible to use it by adding the parameter `UsePowerShellGetCompatibilityModule`_x000D__x000A_ to the `build.ps1`, e.g. `./build.ps1 -Tasks noop -ResolveDependency -UsePSResourceGet -UsePowerShellGetCompatibilityModule`._x000D__x000A_ _The 2.9.0-preview has since then been unlisted, the compatibility__x000D__x000A_ _module will now be released as PowerShellGet v3.0.0.__x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_### Changed_x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_- Task `publish_nupkg_to_gallery`_x000D__x000A_ - Add support for publishing a NuGet package to a gallery using the .NET SDK in addition to using nuget.exe. Fixes [#433](https://github.com/gaelcolas/Sampler/issues/433)_x000D__x000A_- Split up unit tests and integration tests in separate pipeline jobs since_x000D__x000A_ integration tests could change state on a developers machine, and in the_x000D__x000A_ current PowerShell session. Integration tests no longer run when running_x000D__x000A_ `./build.ps1 -Tasks test`. To run integration tests pass the parameter_x000D__x000A_ `PesterPath`, e.g. `./build.ps1 -Tasks test -PesterPath 'tests/Integration'`._x000D__x000A_- Added sample private function and public function samples to Plaster template_x000D__x000A_ _SimpleModule_ so that it is possible to run task `test` without it failing._x000D__x000A_- Sample Private function tests updated to Pester 5._x000D__x000A_- Sample Public function tests updated to Pester 5._x000D__x000A_- Sampler's build.ps1 and the template build.ps1 was aligned._x000D__x000A_- PowerShell Team will release the PSResourceGet compatibility module_x000D__x000A_ (previously known as CompatPowerShellGet) as PowerShellGet v2.9.0 (or_x000D__x000A_ higher). The resolve dependency script, when PowerShellGet is used, will_x000D__x000A_ use `MaximumVersion` set to `2.8.999` to make sure the expected_x000D__x000A_ PowerShellGet version is installed, today that it is v2.2.5._x000D__x000A_ _The 2.9.0-preview has since then been unlisted, the compatibility__x000D__x000A_ _module will now be released as PowerShellGet v3.0.0.__x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_### Fixed_x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_- Fix unit tests that was wrongly written and failed on Pester 5.5._x000D__x000A_- There was different behavior on PowerShell and Windows PowerShell when_x000D__x000A_ creating the module manifest. So when the `modify` section that was meant_x000D__x000A_ to reuse the already present but commented `Prerelease` key it also ran_x000D__x000A_ the `modify` statement that adds a `Prerelease` key that is needed for_x000D__x000A_ a module manifest that is created under Windows PowerShell. This resulted_x000D__x000A_ in two `Prerelease` keys when creating a module under PowerShell 7.x._x000D__x000A_ Now it will add a commented `Perelease` key and then next `modify` statement_x000D__x000A_ will remove the comment, making it work on all version of PowerShell._x000D__x000A_ Fixes [#436](https://github.com/gaelcolas/Sampler/issues/436)._x000D__x000A_- The QA test template was updated so that it is possible to run the tests_x000D__x000A_ without the need to add a git remote (remote `origin`).
